body: You said that in a fully cached run, the logs always get uploaded. For partially cached runs, is there a correlation between a cache hit/miss and whether the log gets uploaded?
On a cache hit, the logs do get uploaded.

@tjgq I debugged this a little more and basically what seems to be happening is for some reason, RemoteCache calls uploadFile with writePolicy DISK_CACHE_ONLY through some code path (I haven't been able to trace which codepath makes this happen). Then, when the BES upload happens with REMOTE_CACHE_ONLY, since the digest is the key, the AsyncTaskExecutor doesn't execute it because `force` isn't set to true.

Unsure of where the DISK_CACHE_ONLY comes from.

Oddly, `--noremote_upload_local_results` seems to be why we initially try to upload with `DISK_CACHE_ONLY`, however, even if I change that flag to `--remote_upload_local_results`, it still doesn't work (however, it *does* work with my patch above), so maybe I traced the wrong code path...

Thanks for the investigation. This makes the issue look a bit similar to https://github.com/bazelbuild/bazel/issues/20296. Perhaps the same fix (properly accounting for a combined cache in `AsyncTaskCache`) will work for both cases.

It does sound like the same underlying issue (and the proposed fix is basically what I did in my patch, ironically). Is there a workaround or a plan for a fix for this since it's quite annoying to not have all your assets uploaded to your remote cache (and the linked issue is a few months old)?

Happy to take a stab at a PR myself (hopefully pointing me in the right direction for a fix).

issue.title: Account for cache type for uploads in AsyncTaskCache

labels.name: team-Remote-Exec
labels.description: Issues and PRs for the Execution (Remote) team

labels.name: awaiting-user-response
labels.description: Awaiting a response from the author

repository.name: bazel
repository.description: a fast, scalable, multi-language and extensible build system

issue.body:
Currently, the AsyncTaskCache for remote execution uses the digest as a key to determine whether or not a task has already been run. Normally this works if there is only a single cache in use. However, when using a disk cache and a remote cache, some calls try to upload files using only a single cache through one code path and another cache through another code path.

This is problematic if only disk caching is used through one code path, when remote caching is enabled though another code path (ie, uploading BES referenced artifacts), the files are not uploaded to the remote cache since the digest is the same. This change uses a String of the digest and the cache type as the key rather than just the digest to allow for uploading to both caches.

The download path is not affected by this bug, so we don't need to make any changes there.

Also, update the combined cache test to reflect what should happen:
when remote_build_event_upload=all, *all* files referenced in the BES
stream are uploaded, including build artifacts (this test now functions as intended based on documentation due to this change).


Fixes #20962, #20296
